Study involves underpinnings of the process of replication, transcription and translation of the genetic material. Much of the work in molecular biology is quantitative, recently much work has been done at the interface of molecular biology and coputer science in bioinformatics and computational biology. Molecular biology explores cells, their characteristics, parts, and chemical processes, and pays special attention to how molecules control a cell's activities and growth

The program for molecular biology is designed to provide an intensive exposure to the theoretical concepts and experimental techniques of molecular biology.A focus on moleuclar biology, therfore, provides an excellent preparation for a wide range of advanced studies including basic research, medicine, bioengineering, and biotechnology. We quickly and easily detect the top bacterial

Foodborne pathogens in a broad range of food and environmental samples with our PCR assays. We use real-time PCR technolgy to provide rapid and accurate testing for the presence of pathogens, and because we have a team of experts, we have teh expertise to develop new diagnostic PCR tests to address the requirements. Oceanaa Laboratories has an extensive series of pathogen-related tests using molecular-based detection. Some of our routinely analyzed pathogens food test are listed below

Instruments & Machineries Used

PCR

Gel documentation system

Laminar air flow hood Labconco USA

RTPCR

A gel documentation system, also known as a gel documentation system, gel image system or gel imager, refers to equipment widely used in molecular biology laboratories for the imaging and documentation of necleic acid and protein suspended withih polyacrylamide or agarose gels

A laminar flow cabinet or laminar flow closet or tissue culture hood is a carefully enclosed bench desighned to prevent contamination of semiconductor wafers, biological samples, or any particle sensitive materials.

Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), a variant of polymerase chaing reaction (PCR), is a technique commonly used in molecular biology to detect RNA expression
